intro: Galium chitralensis, commonly known as Chitral bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayas and parts of Central Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white or pale yellow flowers during the summer months. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and mountain meadows. Galium chitralensis is often used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory and healing properties.
